correction_response:
This tweet is misinformed. The issue of the ozone layer is still being discussed and monitored. The World Meteorological Organization (WMO) continues to enforce the Montreal Protocol on ozone-depleting chemicals, as there are still enough of these substances in the atmosphere to cause annual ozone depletion. The 2020 Antarctic ozone hole was one of the largest on record. However, the public's environmental concerns have shifted towards greenhouse gases like CO2. The ozone hole is expected to heal by 2050, thanks to the Montreal Protocol, but we may continue to see large Antarctic ozone holes until about 2025 due to lingering ozone-depleting chemicals.
